tit.cmt: ()内で記事の内容を補足しました。※ヘボン式ローマ字表記では長音のUは表記しないため、以後TankouはTankoに改めます。

sen.j: 短甲（たんこう）は弥生時代から古墳時代にかけて用いられた甲（鎧、よろい）の形式名のひとつ。
sen.e: Tankou is one of the formal names of Kou (armor) used between Yayoi Period and Tumulus Period.
Tanko is one of the formal names of Ko (armor) used between Yayoi Period and Tumulus Period.
Tanko is one of the formal names of Ko (armor) used between Yayoi Period and Tumulus Period.

sen.j: 木製・革製・鉄製のものがあり、原則として肩から腰の胴体を保護する。
sen.e: The Tankou were made of wood, leather and iron, basically protecting the torso from shoulder to waist.
The Tanko were made of wood, leather and iron, basically protecting the torso from shoulder to waist.
The Tanko were made of wood, leather and iron, basically protecting the torso from shoulder to waist.

sen.j: 胴甲。
sen.e: They were body armors.
They were body armors.
They were body armors.

sen.j: 主に古墳の副葬品として出土し、埴輪や石人にも見られる。
sen.e: They were unearthed mainly as burial goods, and also as haniwa and stone sculptures.
They were unearthed mainly as burial goods, and the tanko can be seen in design of haniwa and stone sculptures.
sen.cmt: 「埴輪や石人にも見られる」＝「埴輪や石人にも短甲を付けている姿を表現したものがある」と解釈しました。
sen.e: They were unearthed mainly as burial goods, and the tanko can be seen in design of haniwa and stone sculptures.

sen.j: 方形や三角形の鉄板や革などの素材を人間の胴体に合うように加工し、板を合わせて鋲で留め蝶番による開閉装置が施された。
sen.e: They were crafted to fit human torsos using square and triangular iron plates or leathers, equipped with opening and closing hinge apparatus made by two plates fixed by nails.
They were crafted to fit human torsos using square and triangular iron plates or leathers, those plates or leathers were tacked down and equipped with opening and closing hinge apparatus.
sen.cmt: 文章の流れを修正しました。
sen.e: They were crafted to fit human torsos using square and triangular iron plates or leathers, those plates or leathers were tacked down and equipped with opening and closing hinge apparatus.

sen.j: 腰部がくびれた形となっている。
sen.e: They have slender waists.
They have slender waists.
They have slender waists.

sen.j: 副葬品として出土する甲には2代形式があり、「短甲」の呼称は奈良時代の文献である『東大寺献物帳』（天平勝宝8歳・756年）や『延喜式』などの文献において「短甲」と「挂甲」の記述や見られるため、明治期の考古学や歴史学において歩兵用と騎馬兵用に対応するとして「短甲」の名称が当てられた。
sen.e: The Kou (armor) unearthed as burial goods have 2 forms, and the name 'Tankou' was applied corresponding to armors for foot soldiers and cavalrymen in archaeology or historical science of Meiji era because 'Tankou' and 'Kakeyoroi (lacquered armor for ceremony)' appeared in the document of Nara period "Todai-ji Temple Kenmotsu-cho (Lists of Treasures dedicated to Temples)"(in 756) and ""the Engishiki" (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers).

The Ko (armor) unearthed as burial goods have 2 forms, and the name 'Tanko' was applied corresponding to armors for foot soldiers and cavalrymen in archaeology or historical science of Meiji era because 'Tanko' and 'Keiko (lacquered armor for ceremony)' appeared in the document of Nara period "Todai-ji Temple Kenmotsu-cho (Lists of Treasures dedicated to Temples)"(in 756) and "the Engishiki" (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers).
sen.cmt: Tankou→Tanko, Kou→Koに訂正しました。""the Engishiki"→"the Engishiki"余分な記号を削除しました。Web上で確認したところ「挂甲」にはけいこうという読みがあり、後に原文にも「（けいこう）」と読みが出てくるので（漢字は異なる）ここでもKeikoとしました。
sen.e: The Ko (armor) unearthed as burial goods have 2 forms, and the name 'Tanko' was applied corresponding to armors for foot soldiers and cavalrymen in archaeology or historical science of Meiji era because 'Tanko' and 'Keiko (lacquered armor for ceremony)' appeared in the document of Nara period "Todai-ji Temple Kenmotsu-cho (Lists of Treasures dedicated to Temples)"(in 756) and "the Engishiki" (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers).

sen.j: 文献においては「短甲一領」が胴部のみのものを意味し、「短甲一具」が草摺や冑、肩甲、頸甲、篭手、脛当などの装備一式を意味すると考えられているが、一具の出土例は見られない。
sen.e: According to documents, 'Tankou ichiryo' means the armor covered only torso and 'Tankou ichigu' means complete equipment including Kusazuri tassets, samurai warrior helmet, pauldron, neck armor, gauntlet and shinguard, though there is no example of complete equipment unearthed.

According to documents, 'Tanko ichiryo' means the armor covered only torso and 'Tanko ichigu' means complete equipment including Kusazuri tassets, samurai warrior helmet, pauldron, neck armor, gauntlet and shin guard, though there is no example of complete equipment unearthed.

sen.j: 現存するのは主に鉄製や金銅製のものであるが、有機質材料が併用されていた可能性が指摘されており、近年は弥生時代終末期の遺跡から木製や革製、植物繊維を編んで漆を塗ったものなどさまざまな有機質材料の短甲も出土している。
sen.e: The Tankou existing now are mainly made of iron or gilt bronze, however, some pointed out that it is possible organic material was also used to make them and various Tankou made of organic material such as wood, leather and knitted plant fiber with lacquer on it were unearthed from the remains of the late Yayoi period in recent years.

sen.j: 木製短甲は丸太の湾曲部を残して刳り貫いたものや、方形板を合わせて漆を塗ったもので、文様や着色などの装飾が施されているものもある。
sen.e: The wooden Tankou was crafted by hollowing out the log other than curved part or by putting square plants together with lacquer on it, and some of them have decoration such as pattern and color on it.

sen.j: 木製短甲は、背側と胸（胴部）側を別個につくり、紐で綴じ合わせる型式のもので、弥生時代後期の静岡県浜松市伊庭遺跡の溝から出土し、古墳時代の実例は、奈良県橿原市坪井遺跡の前期の溝から出土している。
sen.e: The wooden Tankou used the form binding the back part and chest part (torso) made separately together by thread, unearthed from the ditch of Iba site in Hamamatsu City, Shizuoka Prefecture of the late Yayoi period, and from the ditch of Tsuboi site in Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture of Tumulus period.

sen.j: 前者の短甲はヤナギ材でつくられており、前胴に当たる部分と背当ての部分の2点が出土している。
sen.e: The former Tankou was made of a willow, and the frontal torso part and back part have been unearthed.

sen.j: 表面には同心円文や渦巻文、平行線文、羽状文、三角文などの文様が凸状に明瞭に刻まれている。
sen.e: There are patterns such as doshinen-mon design, spiral-mon design, parallel lines-mon design, feather-mon design and triangle-mon design clearly curved convexly on them.

sen.j: さらに、それらの文様は赤色顔料や黒漆で塗り分けられている。
sen.e: And those patterns are two-toned with red pigment and black lacquer.

sen.j: 材質が木製であることや呪術的な文様などから実戦用ではなく祭具用と考えられている。
sen.e: They are believed to have been used as a ceremonial implement not used in an actual battle since they are made of wood and have magical patterns.

sen.j: 古墳時代には鉄製短甲が出現し、横矧板鋲留が安定した形式として普及する。
sen.e: The Tankou made by iron appeared in Tumulus period, and Yokohagibyoudome (nailing horizontally long iron plates together) prevailed as a stable form.
The Tanko made by iron appeared in Tumulus period, and Yokohagiitabyodome (nailing horizontally long iron plates together) prevailed as a stable form.

sen.e: By 6th century, Keikou had replaced them and Tankou made after that were not unearthed.

sen.j: 中国の歩兵用の鎧の影響が色濃く、同時期に用いられた鎧に、中国北方の遊牧民の騎兵用の鎧の影響を色濃く受けた挂甲（けいこう）がある。
sen.e: The armors used by Chinese foot soldiers had so much effect on them that Keikou made around the same time influenced by armors for cavalry of nomad in northern China was found.
